intro: Aragoa funckii, commonly known as the Funck's aragoa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Aragoa funckii is often found growing in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes.
